Data Structures 1: Union-Find

01 Sep 2024

Over Summer 2024, I participated in a seminar led by Jenweil Yang that was focused on applied data structures. Near the end, he asked that participants present on a data structure of interest to them, and suggested I present on the Union-Find. You can find my slides here.

The content was aimed at an audience with various levels of experience, so I spend some time there going over basic definitions for sets and graphs. Iâ€™m planning to follow this up with a post giving a more condensed run-down on the Union-Find, and eventually one on its sister, the Partition Refinement.
